snippet: The earwax of Caucasian men contains more volatile organic compounds than that of East Asian men, researchers at the Monell Chemical Senses Center in Philadelphia found.
abstract: Dr Geroge Preti study in The Journal of Chromatography B suggests that smell of person's earwax depends partly on ethnic origin, suggesting that substance could be an overlooked source of personal information and potentially valuable diagnostic tool.
lead_paragraph: The earwax of Caucasian men contains more volatile organic compounds than that of East Asian men, researchers at the Monell Chemical Senses Center in Philadelphia found.

headline.print_headline: Human Biology: Earwax’s Smell Influenced by Ethnicity
